contents.Text: [[[underline:Soft Purple]]] ≈ Manage Keys
[[[underline:Soft Yellow]]] ≈ Save Changes to disc
[[[underline:Dark Blue]]] ≈ Key
[[[underline:Light Green]]] ≈ Active
[[[underline:Pale Orange]]] ≈ Executable
[[[underline:Soft Peach]]] ≈ Codec
[[[underline:Deep Green]]] ≈ YT_dlp_args
[[[underline:Cyan Blue]]] ≈ Main
[[[underline:Crimson Red]]] ≈ Main Keys
Allows the user to manage (add, remove) dropdowns and dropdown bodies.
This adds a new key/playlist.
This removes selected key/playlist.
This hides the add/remove dropdown.
Simply saves all changes made to disc. (Upon changes, the button colour is set to red.)
Key holds the name and data of a playlist or list of URLs.
This enables or disables the key for download.
(Disabled means it will not download anything in the disabled key.)
This is the executable for helping with the download process.
This field is no longer needed but is here for flexibility in the future.
This is the container/format you will save the songs into.
[[[strong:Lossy codecs:]]] compress audio by removing some data, resulting in smaller file sizes but reduced quality ([[[warning:Lossy]]]).
[[[strong:Lossless codecs:]]] retain all original audio data, providing higher quality at the cost of larger file sizes ([[[warning:Lossless]]]).
[[[strong:• AAC]]] - Lossy codec with better quality than MP3 ([[[warning:Lossy]]]).
[[[strong:• ALAC]]] - Apple's lossless codec for high-quality playback ([[[warning:Lossless]]]).
[[[strong:• FLAC]]] - Lossless codec for audiophile-grade music ([[[warning:Lossless]]],[[[strong:Recommended]]]).
[[[strong:• M4A]]] - Container for AAC or ALAC audio, primarily used in Apple's ecosystem ([[[warning:Lossy]]]).
[[[strong:• MP3]]] - Classic lossy codec with decent quality but outdated ([[[warning:Lossy]]]).
[[[strong:• Opus]]] - Advanced codec for optimal quality-to-efficiency ratio with variable bitrates ([[[warning:Lossy]]],[[[strong:Recommended]]]).
[[[strong:• Vorbis (Ogg)]]] - Open-source lossy codec with good quality at low bitrates; the [[[strong:grandpa]]] of Opus ([[[warning:Lossy]]]).
[[[strong:• WAV]]] - Uncompressed format for highest audio quality, but large file sizes ([[[warning:Lossless]]]).
[[[warning:NOTE]]] Opus and M4A are not natively supported by "RhythmiRust"
since there is no native [[[strong:Opus, M4A]]] decoder published yet, so these two formats use a fallback decoder when playing them.
These are customisable arguments on how you want to download.
This is a very advanced subject, so for normal users starting from zero, top to bottom, use option 1 (with thumbnails) or 3 (without thumbnails).
For those advanced users who want to customise or understand these in depth, here is the page for that: [[[button:Advanced args page][YT_dlp_args]]].
However, I will mention arguments in YT_dlp args that "RhythmiRust" added:
download_dir: Is replaced with the path of the target directory where a song will be downloaded into.
target_url: This is the "URL" that will be passed to yt-dlp.
codec: Is replaced with the song's codec.
ffmpeg_path: Target of the ffmpeg binary in the config (so the user does not need to install ffmpeg manually and so "RhythmiRust" can manage ffmpeg itself).
This holds the list of URLs/keys.
This is a key/URL where you save information into.
test1 is the item name of another key.
"Add Name here" is what the playlist folder will be called in the download folder.
For example, if you input a name of "playlist/hi", then it will make a directory called "playlist", then inside make a directory called "hi", then it will download into "hi".
"Add URL here" is where you add the URLs you want to download into that folder.
Hit "save" once you are done, then "save changes" to finalise them.
Tip: As of version "0.1.5", you can use "https://soundcloud.com/username/sets" and "https://www.youtube.com/@username/playlists", and these will download all that user's public playlists.
Before, it was able to download from these URLs but it was only single-threaded, so now it will download them in batches like it does for all normal playlists.
